link_insst: INSST: Heat stress and thermal risk

notify.uvModerate: Moderate UV index. Sun protection recommended if exposed.
notify.uvHigh: High UV index. Use sun protection and limit prolonged exposure.
notify.uvVeryHigh: Very high UV index. Sun protection is essential.
notify.uvExtreme: Extreme UV index. Avoid direct sun exposure.

alerts_none: There are currently no active weather alerts.
uv_night_message: There is no UV radiation at night.
uv_night_info: It is nighttime. There is no UV radiation risk.

uv.safe_time_hint: Indicative estimate. Use sun protection and reduce exposure during peak hours.

heat.low: Safe conditions. Stay hydrated and avoid direct sun during peak hours.
heat.moderate: Hydrate often, take breaks in cool areas, and avoid intense effort.
heat.high: High risk: limit outdoor activity, drink water frequently, and seek shade.
heat.extreme: Extreme danger: avoid going outside. High risk of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.

cold.low: Cool night: dress lightly and keep adequate ventilation.
cold.moderate: Dress in layers and avoid prolonged exposure outdoors.
cold.high: High risk: protect extremities and limit time outside.
cold.extreme: Severe danger: avoid going outside. Frostbite risk in minutes.

wind.moderate: Moderate wind: secure light objects and use caution.
wind.high: Strong wind: avoid wooded areas and secure outdoor furniture.
wind.extreme: Violent wind: stay indoors and keep away from trees and unstable structures.

fog.low: Light fog: be careful when travelling.
fog.moderate: Moderate fog: reduce speed and increase following distance.
fog.extreme: Zero visibility: stop travelling until conditions improve.

coast.moderate: Moderate swell: avoid rocky areas and narrow passages.
coast.high: Heavy swell: keep away from breakwaters and surf zones.
coast.extreme: Very heavy swell: extreme risk. Avoid walking near the sea.

insst_heat: INSST: Heat stress and thermal risk
official_advice_share: Follow safety recommendations based on your current risk.

heat.mild: Hydrate often and rest in cool areas.
heat.moderate: Avoid intense effort and seek shade regularly.
heat.high: High risk: limit outdoor activity and hydrate continuously.
heat.extreme: Extreme danger: avoid going outside completely. High heat-stroke risk.

cold.mild: Low temperature: dress warmly and protect your hands.
cold.moderate: Very low temperature: use layers and avoid long exposure.
cold.high: High risk: protect extremities and limit outdoor activity.
cold.extreme: Extreme danger: avoid going outside. Frostbite risk.

wind.breezy: Light winds: no special measures required.
wind.moderate: Moderate winds: secure objects and use extra caution.
wind.strong: Strong winds: avoid wooded areas and secure outdoor furniture.
wind.very_strong: Very strong winds: stay indoors. Avoid unstable structures.

uv.moderate: Apply SPF 30+ sunscreen and wear sunglasses.
uv.high: Avoid sun from 12:00 to 16:00, hydrate, and use higher protection.
uv.very_high: Maximum protection: long-sleeved shirt, cap/hat, sunglasses, and SPF 50+.
uv.extreme: Avoid sun exposure. Extreme risk of eye and skin damage.

official_advice.hydration: Hydrate regularly, even if you are not thirsty.
official_advice.rest: Rest in the shade during prolonged activity.
official_advice.coldClothes: In cold weather, wear layers and windproof protection.
official_advice.secureObjects: Secure outdoor objects that could become projectiles.
official_advice.avoidTrees: Avoid walking near unstable trees or branches.
official_advice.avoidUnstableStructures: Keep away from weak or unstable structures.
official_advice.symptoms: If you feel dizzy, nauseous, or confused, stop activity.
official_advice.symptomsCold: If you have chills, shivering, or confusion, seek shelter and warmth.

official_advice_footer: Based on INSST and AEMET guidance.

rec.safe: Safe conditions. Maintain your usual hydration.
rec.safeWithHighUV: Thermally safe conditions. Use caution due to solar radiation.

uvHigh: High UV index. Strong protection advised.
uvVeryHigh: Very high UV index. Sun protection is essential!
